article.title: Raytheon Nets $173 Million Army Award for Infrared Technology Kits
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: The U.S. Army has awarded Raytheon Company $173 million to provide second-generation infrared kits for a variety of combat systems. The firm-fixed-price award modifies an existing contract and provides an additional 6,153 Horizontal Technology Integration Second Generation-Forward Looking Infrared Block 1 A/B-Kits.
